pull.title: build, guix: Get rid of perl dependency
pull.body:
Perl is required only in Qt to create its own MIME database, which we never use.

Guix build on `x86_64`:
```
b63983137239de664edba06834d48fbfc1957d4c56aaf1b2c4cd253bad2856f9  guix-build-d0433a31534d/output/aarch64-linux-gnu/SHA256SUMS.part
```

verification.payload:
tree f517a1aeaf04cd49ea890d3ca8dcc05e87d3bbfb
parent bb378b6ccdd3804fe38640356e8a27de549c50af
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1662799924 +0200
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1662800073 +0200

build: Add `-no-mimetype-database` option to qt package in depends

We do not use the `QMimeDatabase` class, and this change gets rid of
perl dependency.
Available since Qt 5.13.0.

events.message:
build: Add `-no-mimetype-database` option to qt package in depends

We do not use the `QMimeDatabase` class, and this change gets rid of
perl dependency.
Available since Qt 5.13.0.

guix: Drop perl package

events.body:

Concept ACK
Should keep in mind that for #9913 (scanning qr codes) this will limit our file filtering to only filtering by extensions, which I think is fine, especially given how trivial this would be to revert if MIME checks become necessary.

ACK d0433a31534d49d628ad4eec21fc8a5b00f4d129

this is fine to do, tested that the functionality of where QMimeData is used still works properly. A win in terms of getting rid of a dependency.
